attributes.action: ensure that no public funds are spent on Pope Benedict's visit to the UK in 2010
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pope Benedict is visiting the UK in September 2010. 

As his visit is little more than publicity for the intolerant views of the Catholic church, which are contrary to the values of the UK, it would be wrong for the taxpayer to fund any part of his visit. 

Security should be paid for privately by the Catholic church, including any costs for policing.

Private accommodation should be arranged for the pope and his entourage, which should also be paid for by the Catholic church.

Could the Prime Minister clarify that no public funds will be spent on this unnecessary visit.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
